Name: Dream of A Rusted Sword: Finale
Description: One departs in the dream. Many return from the dream.
QuestDesc: One departs in the dream. Many return from the dream.

Conditions.PreQuestName: Dream of A Rusted Sword: Part II

Dialogues.Speaker: Gren
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, it's you. Good timing. We're just about to leave this hellhole. Tch, this place reeks like fart...

Dialogues.Speaker: Gren
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We… we built a grave for that idiot. Right next to another idiot's grave.

Dialogues.Speaker: Gren
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Got a minute? Rolla and I are heading over to pay him a visit. You know, the whole "talk to the air and pretend the dead are listening" thing. Haha...

Dialogues.Speaker: Gren
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...What's with that look, Champion? You expecting me to break down crying or something? The only damn thing I'm good at aside from fighting is outliving my friends.

Dialogues.Speaker: Gren
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Anyway... I'll just meet you over there. That's the deal.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bezos
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aeolus... he was truly a great Gladiator. I will make sure his story lives on.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bezos
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I understand your sorrow for Aeolus. But Septimont doesn't measure one's sacrifice by whether it was "necessary."

Dialogues.Speaker: Bezos
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you can't understand Aeolus's choice, then think of it this way:

Dialogues.Speaker: Bezos
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He was a Gladiator. That's all there is to it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Gren
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What kind of joke is this, huh? A prank? If I fall for it, is he gonna jump out and mock me?

Dialogues.Speaker: Gren
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aeolus, you old fool... You think I'd find this funny?!

Dialogues.Speaker: Gren
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Damn you Gladiators... Damn the Dark Tide... Damn it all!

Dialogues.Speaker: Gren
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …I'll tell Rolla later. Just—just give me a moment. I'll see you around.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Did you build this?

Dialogues.Speaker: Rolla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Uncle Gren helped too. He's probably off slaying more Dark Tide creations. Been cursing nonstop.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rolla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …I recently had a dream of my childhood.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rolla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I dreamed of Dark Tide creations attacking the village. No reinforcements. Just two Gladiators holding the line. When the monsters were about to kill me, a Gladiator picked me up and ran.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rolla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He was crying, holding me tight, running away from the battlefield... from his companion.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rolla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: His face was covered in tears. He kept saying sorry. Called himself a coward.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rolla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Why did you say that, Gramp? You've always been my hero.

Dialogues.Speaker: Letter from Ephor's Palace
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
To Gladiator Lord Aeolus,

I have received your withdrawal request. It is hereby denied. The glory of Septimont shall forever shine upon you—a true Gladiator.

Also, Master Aeolus, you were the seventh formidable opponent I faced on my path forward. Your swordsmanship and keen battle instincts left a deep impression on me. I will carry your blade, your ideals, and everything you stood for, and lead Septimont forward.

Please, bear witness.

Highest regards,
Ephor Augusta of Septimont
